About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

I was born on October 18th, 1996 in La Paz, Bolivia. I lived in Bolivia until I was 15 and I moved with my dad to North Carolina, USA. There I learned to speak English and graduated from high school. I came back to Bolivia to study Computer Science Engineering and graduated in 2019. Right now, I'm looking for opportunities to develop my skills as a programmer in web and mobile development, AI and as a Cloud Services engineer to help make my country and the world a better place. My hobbies are traveling, photography, videogames and volleyball.

Huawei ICT Competition 2018-2019

Global Final 3rd Price Winner

I participated in Huawei’s ICT Competition on the Cloud Track and with my team made our way to the global final in Shenzhen, China where we got the 3rd prize! I had an amazing experience learning a lot about Cloud Services, AI and Big Data. I also got the opportunity to see Huawei’s Solutions and Innovation expo and got a mind opening look at what the future looks like motivating me to build a better world. And last but not least I loved getting to know friends from all over the world and learning about different cultures.

Bolivian Postal Agency

Full Stack Developer Internship

I did a small module of the Bolivian Postal Agency intern software from zero. I did everything from data base modeling to backend and front end. It was an interesting experience because they were rebuilding and updating their software, so I had to go asking the employees that were going to use my software how things worked around there, and based on what they told me I designed all the structure of the module. I learned to use the Laravel framework and how to plan and design everything needed for a full stack application in that framework.

University Social Security

Mobile Developer Internship

I developed a mobile application based on a system about reservations and emergencies of the University Social Security. A desktop application system already existed and I had to use and upgrade a little bit of the backend to be able to implement it with an Android app. The application consisted of two parts: booking of doctor’s appointments and emergency button that sends location and medical history to authorities. I learned how to use Android Studio and how to integrate an existing system to a new application.
